cheatsheet.Rmd

Data sample (realized \(\tilde{}\) DGP)

\[\begin{equation} \tilde{\textbf{X}}= \begin{bmatrix} \tilde{x}_{L1} & ... & & \tilde{x}_{Lk} \\ ... & & & ... \\ \tilde{x}_{11} & ... & & \tilde{x}_{1k} \\ \tilde{x}_{21} & & & \tilde{x}_{2k} \\ ... & & & ... \\ \tilde{x}_{nt} & ... & & \tilde{x}_{nk} \\ \end{bmatrix} \end{equation}\]

\[\begin{equation} \tilde{\textbf{x}}_{t}=(\tilde{x}_{1t}, \tilde{x}_{2t},...,\tilde{x}_{kt}) \end{equation}\]

Data generating process (DGP) and its regression model

  • \(\{(x_{1t},x_{2t},...,x_{kt},y_{t});t=1,2,..,,n\}\)
  • Model specifications (examples):
    • Static (contemporanous model)
    • Finite distributed lagged model
      • AR(1)
      • MA(1)
  • Model suggestions 1:
    • Functional form
    • Dummy
    • Index number
  • Model suggestions 2:
    • Time trend
    • Seasonality

Diagnostics

Omitted variables (e.g, (1) trend (2) lagging) Highly persistent time series (I(1)) Serial correlation Heteroskedasticity Simultaneity
Violation TS.3/TS’.3 TS’.1 TS.5/TS’.5 TS.4/TS’.4 TS.3/TS’.3
Detecting Graphical Graphical/(formal) Testing with or without strictly exogenous regressors Testing Economic theory
Correcting (1) Inclulde time trend, (2) more lags First differentiating (I(0) \(\sim \Delta\) I(1)) Transformation/Robust standard errors (HAC) Transformation/Robust standard errors IV-approach

Model estimation

Method

\[\begin{equation} \underset{\hat{\beta}_{j} \text{for} j=0,1,...,k}{\text{OLS: Min RSS}} \end{equation}\]

Properties

Properties finite sample (TS.1-TS.6)

Assumption Property OLS is unbiased OLS is BLUE \(\hat{\beta}_{j} \sim ~ N(,)\)
TS.1: Linear in its parameters v v v
TS.2: No perfect collinarity v v v
TS.3: E(\(u_{t}\)|\(\textbf{X}\))=0 v v v
TS.4: Var(\(u_{t}\)|\(\textbf{X})=0\) v v
TS.5: Corr(\(u_{t}\),\(u_{s}\)|\(\textbf{X})=0\) v v
TS.6: \(u_{t} i.i.d. \sim N(0,\sigma^2_{u})\) v

Properties large sample (TS’.1-TS’.5)

Assumption Property OLS is consistent \(\hat{\beta}_{j} \sim a.s. ~ N(,)\)
TS’.1: TS’1=TS1+Stationarity+Weakly dependency v v
TS’.2: No perfect collinarity v v
TS’.3: E(\(u_{t}\)|\(\textbf{X}_{t})=0\)) v v
TS’.4: Var(\(u_{t}\)|\(\textbf{X}_{t})=\sigma^{2}\) v
TS’.5: Corr(\(u_{t}\),\(u_{s}\)|\(\textbf{X}_{t})=0\) v

Estimation results

Non-robust

Point estimates Statistical Inference
Predictions v
\(R^{2}\) and its adjusted v
Std x
t-tests x
F-test x

Robust

Point estimates Statistical Inference
Predictions v
\(R^{2}\) and its adjusted v
Std v
